summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, primarily between AUSAs and administrative staff, requesting and approving travel for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips to Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and Stockholm, Sweden, for victim interviews and meetings between 2019 and 2020.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Recipient and approver of multiple travel request emails for the Epstein investigation team. He grants approval for trips to conduct interviews.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary author of the travel request emails, coordinating team travel for victim interviews in Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale, and Stockholm for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Member of the investigation team who travels for interviews. In one email, she requests to extend a Los Angeles trip over a weekend for personal time.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Member of the investigation team who travels with Alex or Alison for victim interviews in West Palm Beach and Los Angeles.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Copied on multiple travel request emails, likely involved in administrative or logistical support for the investigation team.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on several travel request emails, providing administrative support for the Epstein investigation travel.

connections.description: Alex submits travel requests for investigation team trips, and Edward Tyrrell reviews and approves them.
They are colleagues on the Epstein investigation team, traveling together for victim interviews.
They are colleagues on the Epstein investigation team, traveling together for victim interviews in West Palm Beach.
They are colleagues on the Epstein investigation team, noted as possible travel pairs for interviews.
Darlene Alleyne is routinely copied on Alex's travel request emails, indicating an administrative support relationship.

events.title: Interview near Stockholm, Sweden
events.description: The investigation team requests travel to conduct an interview near Stockholm, Sweden, for the Epstein investigation, indicating an international dimension to the probe.

events.title: Los Angeles Interviews
events.description: The team plans three days of interviews in Los Angeles on February 26, 27, and 28, 2020, as part of the ongoing Epstein investigation.

events.title: West Palm Beach Interview
events.description: Alex and Maurene travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct a victim interview, requesting a conference room at a hotel.

events.title: Los Angeles Victim Interview
events.description: The team requests travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, with Alex, Alison, and/or Maurene as possible attendees.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing, active investigation into the Epstein case (2018R01618) by the SDNY from at least March 2019 through February 2020.
The investigation involved international travel, with a planned interview near Stockholm, Sweden, in January 2020.
Multiple trips were made to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida, specifically for victim interviews.
The team routinely requested approval to reserve hotel conference rooms for conducting interviews.
The correspondence shows standard government travel approval processes and cost-consciousness (e.g., seeking domestic carrier flights).
